ch.chnoch.thesis.renderer
Class TouchHandler

java.lang.Object
  ch.chnoch.thesis.renderer.AbstractTouchHandler
      ch.chnoch.thesis.renderer.TouchHandler

public class TouchHandler
extends AbstractTouchHandler

This is a basic touch handler that is used for interacting with scenes that don't have support for a physics engine. It supports several different UI interactions. It uses one-finger touch to interact with objects (Short touch and moving for rotation and long touch and moving for translation.) Multitouch is used for camera movement. There are several camera modes that are supported (see MultitouchMode for a detailed list).
The most important method of this class is onTouch, which is a callback method from the Android framework that is called every time a touch event occurs. All the logic and differentiation between the touch events occur within this method.
TouchHandler can be used directly in in applications, can be extended or only used as a guideline. See AbstractTouchHandler for implementations of general helper methods that a touch handler can use.
